reviews.review_msg: Greg makes complicated concepts easy to understand and is very accessible. Class was graded on 6 problem sets (can work in groups) and a final worth 20%. I found him very clear and easy to understand. Though, he did lecture for 2 hours straight, which after a long day makes it hard to pay attention all the way through.

dr lauro is a genius, made this course pretty understandable despite its difficult content. he's super understanding about students' workloads and his assignments are really fair. he's also really helpful during office hours. great guy 10/10

Professor Wang is the best professor I've had at SFU! She ensures that everyone understands a topic and she answers any question without any judgement. I'm not a philosophy major and she made the class easy to understand. Her exams were mainly based on the weekly problem sets so if you completed those you should be good to go. Very approachable!

I don't mix well with her teaching/lecture style, I think it's just me; not her fault. There Are multiple grad students who are driving up the average, us 3rd years are doomed to compete or doing poorly (allocating time away from other classes) I think the grading is unfair. edit: grading was fair enough. Difficulty changed from 5/5 to 3/5
Terrible professor. Terrible teaching skills, bogus research. No idea why she was hired at all.
Waste of money. Literally zero value

Kino is a very nice person who seems to care about her students. She is not, however, a particularly gifted teacher. Unless you're the sort of person who is used to learning on their own without any proper guidance, I would strongly advise against this course.

Nitpicky marker, condescending when students ask questions, went on tangents in class which made even the simplest material seem confusing, disorganized syllabus and assignments, and gave zero directive on the midterm. Avoid her at all costs
Just so frustrating... Assignments were always unclear or had errors. Same with exams. You should just skip lectures and learn outside of class.

Kino is an okay person but not a good teacher at all. She just reads off the slides which are not at all useful for the exams. Does not make any effort to make the class interesting. Kino also makes lots of errors in her calculations. Surprised that someone with a doctorate can be this bad at logic and math.
